javadoc:
Class for merging equate changes. This class can merge equate changes that were made to the checked out version. It can determine where there are conflicts between the latest checked in version and my checked out version. It can then manually merge the conflicting equates.
The EquateMerger takes into account anywhere that code units have been merged. If code units were merged, then this will not try to merge at those addresses. The code unit merger should have already merged the equates where it merged code units.
Important: This class is intended to be used only for a single program version merge. It should be constructed, followed by an autoMerge(), and lastly each address with a conflict should have mergeConflicts() called on it.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs an equate merger.
@param listingMergeMgr the listing merge manager that owns this merger.
methods.name: <init>

params.name: listingMergeMgr
params.comment: the listing merge manager that owns this merger.

methods.name: getOperandScalarConflicts
methods.comment:
Auto-merges equate changes for a scalar value at a particular address and operand.
 It also determines the equate conflicts for this scalar at this address and operand.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address of the code unit.

methods.name: sameEquates
methods.comment: Compares two equates to determine if they are equal.

return.comment: true if the equates are equal.

methods.name: getScalars
methods.comment:
Gets an array with all the scalar values at a code unit and operand index.
 There can be multiple sub-operands and therefore multiple scalars for an operand.

methods.name: saveConflict
methods.comment: Saves off the indicated equate conflict.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the operand index of the conflict

params.name: scalar
params.comment: the scalar value of the conflict.

methods.name: merge
methods.comment: Performs the actual eqaute merge into the result program using the indicated program version as the source.

params.name: opIndex
params.comment: the operand index of the equate

params.name: scalar
params.comment: the scalar value of the equate

params.name: chosenConflictOption
params.comment: conflict option indicating whether to keep the latest, my, or original version.

methods.name: mergeAllEquates
methods.comment:
Merges all the equates for the address set. It merges into the result version from the
 version indicated by the conflict option.

params.name: chosenConflictOption
params.comment: conflict option indicating whether to keep the latest, my, or original version.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor providing user with status or allowing merge to be canceled.

methods.name: setupConflictPanel
methods.comment: Sets up the equate conflict panel to present a choice to the user.

methods.name: getEquateInfo
methods.comment:
Gets the strings for presenting a row of equate information as column data.
 This is used to present the conflict in a table format.

params.name: equate
params.comment: the equate to display from that version.

methods.name: getChoice
methods.comment: Creates the string for the option or choice column of a row.

name: EquateMerger
comment:
Class for merging equate changes. This class can merge equate changes 
 that were made to the checked out version. It can determine
 where there are conflicts between the latest checked in version and my
 checked out version. It can then manually merge the conflicting equates.
 The EquateMerger takes into account anywhere that code units have been merged.
 If code units were merged, then this will not try to merge at those addresses.
 The code unit merger should have already merged the equates where it 
 merged code units.
 Important: This class is intended to be used only for a single program 
 version merge. It should be constructed, followed by an autoMerge(), and lastly
 each address with a conflict should have mergeConflicts() called on it.
